Utterances.UttText: Cage is a 55yo female presenting with exertional chest pain.

Phrases.PhraseText: a 55yo female presenting with exertional chest pain.

Utterances.UttText: Last episode was 3 days ago and occurred when carrying heavy groceries.
During which time she endorsed SOB and some mild nausea.
She also experiences some mild substernal discomfort after meals.

Phrases.PhraseText: some mild substernal discomfort after meals.

Utterances.UttText: No pain or symptoms with rest.
Describes the discomfort as a 7/10 and says that it is a dull ache and heavy feeling.
Negative ROS at time of interview.

Phrases.PhraseText: Negative ROS at time of interview.

Utterances.UttText: Objective: VS: T98 R85 R14 BP 150/92 P.E.:
RRR, lungs CTA bilaterally, extremities are warm and well perfused.
Denies abdominal or chest tenderness with palpation.
PMHx: HTN Family history concerning for CAD in father (died from MI at 40) and pulm. embolism in mother Meds- Chlorthalidone, lisinopril  Assessment: Ms.

Phrases.PhraseText: HTN Family history concerning for CAD
pulm. embolism in mother Meds- Chlorthalidone,

Utterances.UttText: Cage is a 55yo female who presents with a several month history of exertional chest pain that subsides with rest.

Phrases.PhraseText: presents with a several month history of exertional chest pain

Utterances.UttText: She also endorsed substernal discomfort that sometimes occurs after meals.

P.E. is benign and PMHx sig. for HTN  Plan: -Cardiac stress test to evaluate for stable angina -EKG to rule out MI -start on PPI to alleviate possible GERD symptoms  Differential -stable angina -GERD -MI -muscle strain -costochondritis

Phrases.PhraseText: possible GERD symptoms  Differential -stable angina -GERD -MI -muscle strain -costochondritis
